intro: Manniophyton africanum var. fulvum, commonly known as the yellow-flowered manniophyton, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to harsh environmental conditions.
